titles: Hesitant adopter, but it has value
reviews: \nI had this product for a year before my daughter offered to help me set it up because she likes hers so much.  My expectations were low and there were not many things I expected it to help with, but I have been reasonably pleased.  It allows my to get items on my grocery list before I forget and generally do tasks I was already doing, but a little easier (set a timer, play a radio station).  Maybe I will find things of more value as I go along. In general I am glad to have it, but it is not life altering.\n

dates: Reviewed in the United States \U0001f1fa\U0001f1f8 on November 17, 2020
titles: My Echo Dot wakes me up every morning with Blake Sheltons voice need I say more?
reviews: \nI love my echo dot it is the best thing I ever did for myself and my family. The reason I love it is that not only do I get Blake Shelton telling me to get up but I can have Pherrel sing the Happy Song and my day just starts out so beautiful. I am a social worker and in this time in history there is so much need in the world, so much anger and pain. The pandemic has taken a toll on all types of people it doesn't care if your rich, poor, purple or if you just so happen to be a germaphobic. It's a product of the human need to control the world around us. This one product allows me to control my environment into any mood I wish, happy and positive is where I find peace.\n

reviews: \nI got it because I had a deal to get one for $4.99 and I wanted to see what it was all about. The real only complaint (if you even want to call it that) is that it's not GREAT for listening to music. Not at a decent volume anyway. Maybe on a low volume setting. It's a small speaker where music was never its primary task. In the end, I love it and would easily get another for what I paid!\n

titles: Alexa Echo dot  is just okay for me.
reviews: \nFor what it is, it\u2019s okay! I got it on sale, couldn\u2019t complain. At first it was going well and slowly I realized the quality wasn\u2019t amazing and often times my voice couldn\u2019t be easily recognized. I\u2019ve been getting a lot of \u201cI\u2019m sorry I don\u2019t know that\u201d responses.. or there would be times when she would just shut off while I\u2019m speaking. She\u2019ll also tell me that she\u2019s capable of doing something and when I try she is unable to do it! Her guard feature is cool but doesn\u2019t recognize sounds, it states she can recognize if a window breaks but I honestly doubt it.. she hears nothing, I\u2019ve tried making lots of noise to test it. Either way it\u2019s good for a small room, or office. I love the charcoal color and the feel of it is very nice. It\u2019s cool to ask the weather and stuff but that\u2019s as far as it goes for me.\n

dates: Reviewed in the United States \U0001f1fa\U0001f1f8 on December 16, 2019
titles: It does everything it claims it does and I haven\u2019t had any issues so far.
reviews:
The media could not be loaded.
                



\xa0I have two Echo Dot 3rd gen.’s. One for my room and kitchen. It’s very useful with setting up reminders and timers when I’m cooking or  when my kids need some time out. I used to waste so much time grabbing my phone to set a timer but now I just tell Alexa to set it for me. Love love love it! The sound quality is great and the volume goes up very high. Oh and I LOVE how I can ask Alexa if I have anything scheduled for the day since I have missed some doctors appointments because I forget but as soon as I say, “Alexa good morning” she responds with anything you set it to. I have her tell me if I have anything schedules, the weather, and the traffic from home to work. If you thought Siri was great, well Alexa is by far the best, and I love my Apple devices. Thanks amazon. Echo Dot is great!

dates: Reviewed in the United States \U0001f1fa\U0001f1f8 on July 22, 2020
titles: Why I like my Echo Dot
reviews: \nI needed a replacement for my bluetooth speaker, decided for the money this was a good speaker and we are enjoying also being able to call on Alexa for information.  Alexa tunes me in to the day's weather,  local NPR station for morning news and classical music and later in day I switch to bluetooth and listen to my Pandora stations.  I haven't taken the time yet to figure out how I might be able to  program My Amazn Prime music to behave like Pandora--which I have used for years--but will work on that.  I'm not a music purist so  the sound quality the Echo produces is just fine with me.  The only problem is not Echo's fault but our internet connection is sometimes slow but that rarely interferes with music streaming the way it does with video.  I'm glad we have the Echo Dot.\n

reviews: \nEverything is good, we have 2 of these Alexa echo dot units then an Amazon show 8 and also an Amazon Alexa Echo the tall one so we have them in different areas of the house and all connected so we can talk to each other thru them and have each one do different things at the same time. reviews: \nLike a science fiction world living with Alexa. When I upgraded our internet, switching to the new network was a breeze. I love using Alexa with Amazon Music. Makes it easy to add to a playlist. Voice is pleasant, and finding answers to fact-based questions is easy. Fun!\n

dates: Reviewed in the United States \U0001f1fa\U0001f1f8 on December 29, 2019
reviews: \nI am impressed with my recently acquired Amazon Echo Dots. Previously, I had used Google Chromecast Audio devices to stream to multiple Vintage systems in different rooms, thereby achieving whole house (like SONOS) audio. The sound quality and functionality of the Echo Dots seem to be better than that of the Chromecasts. And, the overall integration of being able to tell Alexa where and what to play, in addition to powering on a system, makes it very nice. Also, I am really impressed how this is all integrated directly into Spotify Premium, which can also be directed from the desktop or multiply devices. So, this is my current streaming to Vintage solutions. I am currently streaming from an Echo Dot directly into a pair of Dynaco Mark III mono blocks and the sound is fantastic. IMHO, at currently $25, these things are awesome. I am still learning of all the capabilities and have purchased and Echo Show along with several LED bulbs and modules. I also have this integrated with the Ring Doorbell Camera.\n

reviews: \nWe have three Echo dots, one on each of the \u201cmain\u201d rooms of our house. We love the ease of being able to play music whenever our small kids want to hear something or need to have calm time. I like when it\u2019s cooperation with the SmartPlug helps me set the crockpot from work or turn on a light before we get home at night.The only con so far\u2014I had no idea that Alexa would narc on me to my husband about buying packages from Amazon. I tend to order things and put them away before DH can see them. Well, She had a yellow ring one day (my husband set her up, so I hadn\u2019t thought to ask about the ring), and when my husband asked her why she said \u201cYour Amazon package was delivered\u201d and I had to come clean.No one likes a snitch Alexa!***Side note\u2014 you can turn the package delivery notice off. Alexa and I have mended fences from her betrayal.\n

titles: Great to be able to ask question so I don't forget by the time I go to look up online!
reviews: \nAlexa is not only fun to use but very helpful!  I learned to program "Alexa, Good Morning" to get day/date, time, weather and start playing my favorite radio station at volume 9.  I use the timer & alarm.  I liked that I can ask Alexa to set volume to ___ (#) or ask for volume up or down.  Also found how to command for the treble and bass I want for my music.  I've made a couple lists so far, get spellings for words, fun facts and daily holidays.  I got this little gem for a great price and really getting my moneys-worth out of it.  The only down so far is when I ask a question and she doesn't know the answer... but that is to be expected sometimes.  I would definitely recommend this, and I don't even do all the awesome things with it that can be done!\n

reviews: \nFor the most part I enjoy using Alexa.  However there is a bit of a learning curve speaking with her, but I\u2019ve \u2018been trained\u2019 and now that\u2019s fine.  I do have one Very Upsetting issue with Alexa.  I can tell her to open Kindle and read a specific book; she usually complies with the correct book, but sometime chooses the most recently added book to my library instead of what I asked for.  But the really annoying thing is she will read a section and the rereads the section again, moves onto the next section and reads it then rereads that section again.  She\u2019ll go through the entire book like this.  What a bunch of crap!  I really thought having Alexa read a book while I\u2019m doing house work would be so nice, but guess I\u2019m wrong.If anyone has a fix for this please let me know.\n

dates: Reviewed in the United States \U0001f1fa\U0001f1f8 on October 11, 2019
reviews: \nI had this product before and had to rebuy it. My wife and I were staying with some people and we used our Alexa everyday we were there. We use it to play music while we are getting ready, rain sounds while we are sleeping, or classical music for our dog Olivia when we are away. Anyway, this family we were staying with never used Alexa before. My wife decided to show them the device and their son really fell in love with it, he's one years old, and he is the reason I need another one. These people were so happy to see their son trying to say Alexa and watching him dance to different songs. My wife offered MY ALEXA to those people, and they accepted! I was so sad to leave her behind. Once we left, I would shout Alexa randomly in my own home and no one answered! I finally demanded that we get another one, so here we are. I will miss Alexa 1 dearly, moral of the story don't let babies near your prized possessions.\n

dates: Reviewed in the United States \U0001f1fa\U0001f1f8 on December 20, 2019
reviews: \nI like things that make life easier and this little device has done that for me.  I have health issues that at times mean I am in bed for days or weeks at a time, so I keep this on the nightstand beside my bed.. Pairing this up with some smart plugs I can now turn the lights and the TV on /off without having to get out of bed. A lot of things I used to have to dig out my phone for I can now do with just my voice like call people, check the time, the weather and other useful things.While it can seem limited in the scope of things it can do right now, the built-in Alexa functions are always improving over time and more and more capabilities and "Skills" are being developed. As time goes on I can see this getting better and better.I am enjoying my Echo Dot and I would have no problem recommending this device to anyone who is interested.\n

reviews: \nI have put off buying the echo for years until the special combo of 2 months with Amazon Music Service for less than $20. I'm Very pleased with the purchase. I've used Alexa with my Kindle Fire but really didn't find much use except asking the Forecast or asking silly questions but the audio quality of the music service is nice. I'm understood when asking to play songs, albums and artist. It's pleasant when asking Alexa to read my ebooks which I've used the Unlimited ebook service since my eyesight began failing.  It's been a bonus to add the Echo with my Kindle as low vision tools I need to use on a daily basis. I Highly recommend the new generation 3.  I'm thinking of purchasing the new 2020 Kindle 8 with the wireless docking stand.\n

reviews: \nThis is actually my second one purchased that was a gift for my father. I brought mine over before Christmas and he loved it to. You can set it to recognize your voice which fixes some issues it has understanding you sometimes. The only cons I have are that if you have music playing a little louder, it has a hard time hearing the wake word. I find myself yelling at it to pause or skip. The last thing is that it doesn\u2019t get too loud and the sound quality isn\u2019t the best if your listening to music at those higher volumes. This can easily be fixed by pairing a Bluetooth device to it through the app and it will use that for sound output. Overall it\u2019s an excellent product and I want to get myself a second one so that I can keep one in my bedroom as well as the living room because I use the smart plugs and would like to expand those throughout my house.\n

dates: Reviewed in the United States \U0001f1fa\U0001f1f8 on August 23, 2019
reviews: \nThis is a great smart speaker with great sound. The quality is better than google home mini. I have 2 google smart speakers (1 regular, 1 mini) and I have been happy with them, but I wanted the guard and burglar deterrent features which google so far does not have. I believe setting up various music applications (spotify, tunein, pandora) is easier on the echo dot. Right now these miracle workers are on sale for $29 which is quite a bargain and I would recommend them to all technophiles. Watch out for iphone apps to set this device up (Setting Up Alexa, etc.) -- some are demanding money and don't add anything to the device. Amazon should not allow these apps to be sold on Apple store (don't know if they exist on google store). The ONLY app that you need is "Amazon music" which is created by Amazon, not some scammer. Note Amazon does not demand money to add skills (at least music, burglar deterrent, guard), so if your app asks for money (Prime), then you have downloaded an app which is a scam.\n

titles: Watch out for scam iphone apps for alexa!!
